title: [Large-scale] Storytelling-Based Mathematical Modeling and Problem-Posing Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of foundational algebra, statistics, calculus, and mathematical modeling concepts
context.additional_context: Focuses on situational problem-solving activities based on real job cases, emphasizing peer collaboration and feedback

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of converting problems encountered in real job situations into mathematical models.

Learners will creatively construct three mathematics problem scenarios using storytelling techniques and achieve an "Excellent" rating in at least two of the four peer/teacher evaluation criteria (Creativity, Logical Consistency, Mathematical Validity).
Learners develop a protocol for applying mathematical modeling stages to problem-solving processes.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
